resources.name: loginUser
resources.description: Responds with nebula and takserver user data and sets a cookie. **You should send this cookie with all other requests.**

resources.name: buildBlueprint
resources.description:
Instantiates a job from given blueprint.

* `srcFiles` maps slot names to file definitions.

* (OPTIONAL) `overrideVars` maps blueprint var names to new overridden values
* (OPTIONAL) `save`: `(true|false)` *Default: `true`*  - saves the job to the database, otherwise just returns it. Possible usecase of setting this to false is to instatiate a job structure from a blueprint but then override things in it manually and then save it via the `jobs->createJob` command.
* (OPTIONAL) `start`: `(true|false)` *Default: `true`* - immediately queues the job (only applicable when `save` is `true`)

resources.name: buildBlueprint (multiselect)
resources.description:
Instantiates multiple jobs from a blueprint, from supplied files. Only works when there is 1 source slot and if there are other slots their locations and filenames are fully derived from the non-predetermined slot.

* `srcFiles` takes an array of files for the non-predetermined slot.

resources.name: createBlueprint
resources.description:
For creating a blueprint. **For instantiating a job from a blueprint, look at `buildBlueprint`.**
* `data` should contain a full blueprint JSON

resources.name: createJob
resources.description: * `data` should contain a full job JSON

resources.name: pauseJob
resources.description: Pause a job. If any actions are currently being processed, they won't be stopped  until they are completed or error out. No further actions will be started.

resources.name: resumeJob
resources.description: Resumes a paused job.

resources.name: restartJob
resources.description:
`method` options:
- `failedOnly` restarts only the failed actions
- `failedAndComplete` restarts failed and complete actions

resources.name: inviteuser
resources.description:
* `properties`: object (required)
	* `inviteType`: "internal" | "external" (required)
		* `internal`: the user will be added to your Nebula company, so it must not be part of the Nebula ecosystem
		* `external`: this will send an email inviting to join the Nebula ecosystem. once the invitation is accepted they will be added to your company scoped task server as a Contractor (i.e. external user, so they won't be part of your own company)
	* `user_role`: "company_user" | "company_manager" | "company_admin" (required) (relevant for "internal" only)
	* `user`: string (required)
	* `username`: string (required) (relevant for "internal" only)
	* `admin`: boolean
	* `manager`: boolean
	* `emailNotifications`: boolean (default: true)
	* `notes`: string
	* `first_name`: string (relevant for "internal" only)
	* `last_name`: string (relevant for "internal" only)
	* `device_type`: number (check list in action manager info)
	* `device_template`: number (check list in action manager info)
